bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Mary Ann and Adaline O'Neill. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p: In the matter of the application of O'Neil for Habeas Corpus} In District Court at Chambers
To the Honorable Samuel C. Wingard Judge
Mary Ann O'Neil your petitioner shows
1. That she is restrained of her liberty in the county jail of Walla Walla County. W T by George T. Thomas, Sheriff of said Walla Walla County.

2. That the cause or pretense of said restraint as applicant is informed is that your petitioner was convicted of being a vagrant under the 1st section of the Act entitled "An act defining vagrancy and providing remedy against" approved Nov 12 1875

3. That said restraint is illegal in this As proof reorganized by the
act aforesaid was accused to prove the charge set up in complaint No confession of the charge or the introduction of other testimony disclosed by the judgement of correction of the Justice of the Peace before when convictions have

Wherefore petitioner prays Honorable Samuel G Winegard Judge of the District Court of the First Judicial District of Washington Territory and associate Justice of the Supreme Court of said Territory to grant a writ of Habeas Corpus that the cause of detention may be inquired into and your petitioner restored to her liberty
Mary Ann O'Neil Her X Mark
